answers.answer: You would need to first get a consultation with a plastic surgeon.  If your condition is deemed appropriate for insurance coverage, then a pre-authorization from your insurance would be obtained to insure coverage.

question: Hello, I have had diabetes since I was 15, I am now 22.  I was underweight..about 90 lbs prior to the diabetes. I gradually moved up to 120 and recently jumped to 130. I don't mind the weight, just the appearance. I have a huge stomach pouch. I am often asked if I am pregnant. It damages my self esteem very much because I was always so skinny and in shape. I also have problems in my upper arms and thighs, these are all places where I take my shots but I do rotate. I have trouble exercising because I have lyme disease as well and it causes me to be severely fatigued and sometimes I hurt all over. I heard before of someones insurance covering a tummy tuck or liposuction for a woman with type 1 that had the same problem. I would not be able to afford the surgery at least any time soon. I am 5' 2". Thank you for any help or suggestions..I am desperate
title: Type 1 Diabetes and lipo
